page.title: 07 JUDO by Martin Welch
page.content: The Judo Club is situated on Bakers Hill and I used to go on Wednesday nights. Judo is useful for self defence. At classes you all start off with the same exercises then you get onto doing actual judo. We go in for competitions and can win medals and cups and so on. We went as far as Newton Abbot for competitions and also to Torquay and Exeter. I won a bronze medal but in doing so I got badly bruised down my spine so I don't do as much judo now. We did have a karate club, but it was not well supported, so it had to close.
